ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Time spent is all up to you.You could go easy or hard. I went hard and I spent over the allotted 10 hours per week.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This was a great experience. Strengths: It was a real world, practical experience, being immersed in a public health related workplace. Weaknesses: None
Strengths: Getting practical experience Weaknesses: Need more meetings to check in

Take it and avoid Debbie Humphries and her nightmare(everyone I know who took this complained, especially of the abnormally high/crushing workload). I like this course cause it all depends on you.Do as little or as much as you want. You get real hands on experience,learn organizational structure and how to fit in. You'll also learn how to be self directed and self motivated.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  Ms. O'Keefe is a great instructor of this course!! She was always very receptive with her students, giving us her feedback in regards to our journal entries every week, and answering any questions we had. When getting together as a group to discuss the ethics and importance of cultural sensitivity, she was a great instructor, and was very interested in what we were doing in our practicums and how we could apply this to our practicum.

Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  Elaine was great in giving back feedback to the weekly journals. I also appreciate her passion for encouraging us to get into public health practical work which is so important to do, especially in urban areas where health disparities are so large.
Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  very nice and very approachable
Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  excellent mentor and instructor. Extremely knowledgeable and experienced. Loved her
Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  Excellent! Really cares about you and she's exceedingly helpful.
Instructor: Mary Ann Booss  She was away, so can't say.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You have to choose the place in which you are going to do your practicum, by yourself, before the fall term finishes. It was a little stressful to do this, because you had to find a place on your own, contact them, interview with them, etc. I had a great experience in my own practicum. I had to be on site 8 hours a week, and before starting you would get together with your preceptor and draft a work-plan of what you would be doing, and what MPH competencies you would be covering. I had a great experience, and I fully recommend taking this course, because it is a more practical course, in which you are seeing how it would be like to work as a public health professional.

This course is beneficial to take I believe for people who would like to start working after their MPH. I got a lot of insight as to what life would be like after I graduate, even more so than my internship, for that I am very appreciative of the class.
definitely recommend this course to anyone seeking practical experiences in public health.

This course is wonderful 'cause you can tailor it, to suit your needs and work style. Like I said earlier, it's all up to you. Go easy or go hard! One last thing, don't get bogged down about finishing the project as I did. Just do what you have to, as long as you have a clear narrative at the end, about the organization and what you set out to achieve, you'll be fine!
